category1.question: Does this application use ONLY web services (XML/SOAP)?
category1.description: XML provides a common syntax for data transfer between systems. ASM provides an XML profile which defines XML properties that a security policy enforces for an XML application.

category2.question: Is the application a known Application, for which ASM has an Application-Ready Security Policy Template? If so, please select from the available templates.
category2.description: ASM contains predefined templates for known applications to allow easy deployment of ASM policy.

category3.question: Does the Application require protection only from known attacks, or from both known and unknown attacks?

options.label: Protection from known and unknown attacks

category3.description: Protection against known attacks only would require deployment of an ASM policy based on negative security concept, where all traffic is allowed except what was configured to be blocked (often known as blacklist). Protection against unknonwn attacks would require deploment of an ASM policy based on positive security policy concept, where all traffic is blocked except what has been configured to be allowed (often known as whitelist).

tabContent.question: Does the application enforce any navigational  flows between pages? If so, how is it enforced?
tabContent.description: A flow could be defined as a specific route through the application that a user cannot deviate from. This could be something like A -> B -> C -> D, where A is the login page, B is the PIN code validation, C is the disclaimer and D is the account information page. The implication of this flow is that it is impossible for a user to start at B, C, or D  without passing via page A first.

There is no need for navigational flows enforcement
Navigational flows enforcement is needed
